name: Peter G.
pros: Pros: I used to use other social media platforms to invite customers to events or special sales and promotions that I was having to increase sales and also ultimately traffic to my website. I was a littlw hesitant to use Eventbrite at first because it would take thw customer away from my webpage but the customisation options allowed me to really focus on making my events personal to my busibess. I would get updates the instant someone signed up for an event or a sale that I promoted with EventBrite. They offer an outstanding product and will use them again in the near future
cons: Cons: I do not have too much bad to say about EventBrite other then the customer has to leave my page in order to go to the event page. I wish there was an integrated wigit I could use to bring Eventbrite to my social media platforms
overall: Overall: Im trying to bring customers together and get them excited about what we have to offer. Marketing sales as events with Eventbrite makes it a little less intimidating for the customer to make a purchase as it makes them feel apart of something and it makes them feel welcome.

title: Easy webcast registration handler
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: It's easy to create a template and then duplicate it. We offer around 18 different webcasts that repeat every month, so being able to set them up without having to do it all from scratch is nice.
cons: Cons: I don't like it that we are using another piece of software to handle registrations, Eventbrite works great, but our webcast strategy needs some work. We should be using a webcast software that handles registrations so it's a one-stop experience for attendees. This is not a knock against Eventbrite, it's a knock against us!

title: Makes it easy for guests to register for events.
name: Rolake D.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite automates the process of inviting guests to events.Saves paper ,and removes the cost of printing invitation cards ; making it easy for guests to simply register for the event and get an automatic invite email,which they can download as a .pdf file or simply save it on their Eventbrite app.
cons: Cons: Free events created on Eventbrite have very little security as random strangers can easily register and get an invitation for the event.As free events are displayed on the Eventbrite website,with no barrier for strangers to register.

title: Don't know where I would be without Eventbrite!
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: It feels like I have been using Eventbrite for years...I don't remember a time before it! I use this site for both personal and professional use. In my personal life, I use it to book and register for events I am interested in attending. When I want to find unique activities happening in my city, I always go to Eventbrite first. I have used this site many times in the past as an organizer, since I am an Event Planner. Eventbrite is so easy to use and helps track me attendance, allows me to send follow up emails to attendees, processes payment from guests...it has been an absolutely lifesaver to me and I could not recommend it enough.
cons: Cons: I have nothing negative to say about this product.

title: Extremely easy to use with great integration
name: Scott S.
comments: Comments: I love that eventbrite allows for my events to be circulated. After setting up events for myself and a few stores I work with --I do live meditation and spirituality events-- I started to see them in google searches, and circulating on the web. Super easy
pros: Pros: Eventbite! You integrate so seamlessly into facebook! I love you! Easy set up, click and drop, format with low fees and great integration. Easy. Easy and good looking. I even got customers outside of my regular group of folks who attend my events.
cons: Cons: I mean I guess that the website does take a nominal fee from each ticket sold, you can pass that on to customers but I wouldn't. I had some work-around in implementing to my website but they were easily fixed and were more on the end of Squarespace than eventbrite.

title: An event of interest is just a few days away on Eventbrite.
name: Abimbola K.
pros:
Pros: I use Eventbrite majorly to locate "free to attend" local networking events of interest,taking place around my environment.

Over the years ,I have made friends and expanded my business network ; as a result of events,I found on Eventbrite.
cons: Cons: It's been extremely helpful over the past two year period and it is impossible to find anything I dislike about this program.

title: A great tool to handle the wide variety of events you might have across the globe.
name: Chris E.
comments: Comments: We use it to manage dinners and other events both at home and during remote conventions. Really helps us plan and coordinate resources needed, as well as limit the amount of attendees. Easy to set up and easy to manage, an all around great tool.
pros: Pros: Excellent ability to manage and promote multiple events, and multiple types of events. Simple web interface makes it easy to interact with and delegate actions to others.
cons: Cons: There are always one-off issues with invitees, and it's a bit cumbersome to manage these one-offs. Bu this is common among all tools, not just Eventbrite.

title: Does what it needs to, but could do more
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: Effective way of managing lots of events; integrates with automation tools (Workato, Zapier, etc.). Clean interface for users
cons: Cons: Refunds! Can only do 1 refund at a time. Integration isn't as customizable. New format for event creation doesn't allow for HTML editing and restricts photo size to be same width of text block (meaning images come out humongous).

title: Better results if an App for phones is designed.
name: Maria G.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is the best software to take into account events, occasions and even parties, or an anniversary, although of course, this is for something more entrepreneurial, since its functions have timetables and it really helps to remember important dates where some important event may occur.
cons: Cons: I would like Eventbrite to add a version for mobile devices, and in this way it is easier to follow the events that are about to happen to the letter. A good follow-up from the mobile phone, would bring better results.

title: Eventbrite is great for SXSW activities
name: Kathi B.
comments: Comments: Overall this is a great app
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is a great application. It is easy to use, Helps sponsors build their email lists and predict who's going to their events. Gathers all (or most) of my event information in one place, and sends reminders.
cons: Cons: How much information does each sponsor need? It would be great if it could remember all my data and pre ovulate/ save me time.

title: Using Eventbrite for our upcoming techers conference!
name: Amy L.
comments: Comments: I highly recommend eventbrite for any nonprofit event!
pros: Pros: We used to use cvent, which was very expensive. Eventbrite is giving us almost all of the same features without the huge price tag. We can customize the questions so we can easily gather all of the information we need from each attendee. We can schedule reminders to attendees and those who still need to register. We can have all the information we need about attendees and track any changes they make to their registrations in one place. We also used eventbrite to sell tickets for a concert we held last year and it was fantastic. Easy for ticket buyers and we were able to pull lists for the concert that made guest check- in a snap.
cons: Cons: If your event is not a ticketed event it does require more thought and planning to make eventbrite work. That said, it is doable bacuse the pages are flexible, they can be customized.

title: Easy Event Prep
name: Jenna G.
pros: Pros: There are a number of options you can include when sending out event invitations. Minimal hassle for set up. You are able to track ticket sales in real time. It eliminates manual tracking. For participants, all the information they need is ready in one location and tickets are distributed right to their email.
cons: Cons: The app is great. However, when using the computer you need to sign in for every event email you receive and multiple accounts can't be linked. One email address per account and you need to sign in every time.
overall: Overall: Great for events of all sizes especially when the RSVP requires the guest to make choices. Whether it is a large charity gala or an office Christmas party, Eventbrite is easy to use and makes organizing very simple when accommodating guest preferences.

title: Perfect for Planning Events
name: Jeffrey A.
pros: Pros: Our company is constantly holding events for all our distributors around the US. There are a LOT of great features but the cost absolutely can't be beat. Other apps/programs/software have so many added fees for random features that it becomes an expensive hassle to even hold a single event. Not so with Eventbrite. We'd been burnt before with all the little hidden fees that it took some convincing the higher ups to get on board with Eventbrite. Now? They love it. Haven't looked back. It's an easy, hassle-free way to send out mass invites for an exceptional price. Just pump the link into an email and you're good to go. You can even have customizeable discounts and promo codes. I can keep going but I'll save you the reading. If you're using a different event planner, switch over. You'll get glad you did.
cons: Cons: I don't like fishing for cons when there aren't any readily apparent, but if I had to say one negative thing about Eventbrite, it would be the customer service. You'll rarely have need to get in contact with them, but when you do it'll be a struggle. A few more reps, some more training, and an overall cheerier disposition would do them wonders.

title: Practical Tool For Events, Not Without Flaws But Worth It
name: Alicia M.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite makes setting up event invitations and ticket sales seamless for even an inexperienced user. Their template works for almost an function and navigating is fairly intuitive. Many people are familiar with Eventbrite so they're willing to go through the step of clicking into an additional link after reading about the event via social media or email.
cons: Cons: The customizations options are limited. There are not enough options to ask additional questions or gain event related information from the user. The backend data is not easy to access, use or transfer into other applications. While they are cost effective for small organizations, don't be fooled. The fees add up quick. Their per ticket cost is reasonable, but their credit card processing fees are high per industry average.
overall: Overall: When it comes to the simple process of creating a ticketed and/or registered event, it can be done simply and quickly with Eventbrite. Customer service is quick to answer questions via chat or email. It does have limitations; however, without paying a subscription cost, it is still an industry leading tool.

title: I would not recommend Eventbrite
name: Mary Lee C.
pros: Pros: While I do not actually like anything about this software itself, I do like that, although with considerable difficulty, it enables me to book online for events. I simply wish that events would use different software in order to achieve the same end result of allowing booking online.
cons: Cons: I find this software unwelcoming and overly complicated to achieve a seemingly simplistic task. It is even difficult to sign in, and I am rarely sure, even after receiving a confirmation e-mail if I have booked correctly. As a result, I regularly waste time calling the event venue the next day, if a number is provided, to check that all details have been accurately received, and often (not always, but more frequently than I regard as reasonable), despite having received a confirmation e-mail, had I not checked with the venue, I was not booked into the event, which for events with limited space is, of course, potentially especially problematic. As a culture writer, attending arts events is an important aspect of my job, and it is a great time waster and strain whenever an event is done entirely through Eventbrite, as I must check anything possible and still be nervous that I will have trouble attending a sometimes necessary event.
overall: Overall: My experience of Eventbrite has been very poor. It adds a great deal of time and worry to my working day whenever I have to use Eventbrite and follow up on it. Whenever possible, I avoid Eventbrite, and I have found that with some events and venues, while Eventbrite claims there is no availability, if one is able to circumvent Eventbrite and book directly, there is availability, so Eventbrite often seems a useless, even frustrating and counterproductive, unnecessary 'middle man.' I have had so many variedly negative experiences with Eventbrite, that recently, I decided for events that only book through it, if the event can be missed, it is more productive to not attend the event than deal with Eventbrite.

title: THe best way to create an event
name: Natalia R.
pros:
Pros: I use for a long time Eventbrite for creating some events. Is very easy to use, export and manage all the things that you need.

With some clicks, you can create tickets and control your visitors.
cons: Cons: To be honest, I love Eventbrite. Maybe that you can have more control about RRSS and the users that comment about your event

title: Good solution for events, but room for improvement
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: I have used Eventbrite for a variety of events now and I'm impressed by how easy it is to use, along with some great features like their built-in affiliate program and tracking capabilities.
cons: Cons: The fees are fairly high, so especially for larger and higher priced events, this cost ends up being significant. I also wish it would integrate better with other mainstream software, like Hubspot - although you can create smart lists, you still need Zapier to transfer over attendee information.

title: Great software, at a price
name: Mike R.
pros: Pros: Everything Eventbrite does is spectacular. They make it beyond simple to create, manage, take payment, check-in attendees in their app, and receive payment. Even things that seem tricky like adding waivers to tickets and adding custom fields for additional data are extremely simple to use and access. Basically, everything just works as expected.
cons: Cons: Now, with great software, I understand does come a price. However while their fee structure has changed over the years, I still maintain they are taking too large a cut of ticket sales. While the exact percentage does change based on your plan and the price of the ticket you're selling, we consistently see 30% or more of our ticket sales revenue go to to Eventbrite. Again I do understand that you do need to pay for great software, I just wish Eventbrite either took a lower percentage or offered a flat fee option.
overall: Overall: Overall we are extremely satisfied with Eventbrite. Yes, I think their fees are too high, but in terms of actual functionality, Eventbrite pretty much does everything we need it to do extremely well.

title: Eventbrite has been sent to me for small and large scale event ticket purchases.
name: Wendy M.
pros: Pros: The link to eventbrite is easy and user friendly. I like most that it saves your ticket information in a virtual wallet. It also tracks all your purchases. It has been a while since I acquired the app from the apple app store, but I believe it was suggested to download the app to mobile devise to have access to all the cool features.
cons: Cons: The software always asks to use your current location. I have found that allowing access to current location can trigger the app to run in the background of you mobile device. This can also ping you for advertisements that are not wanted.
overall: Overall: The app tracks my events that I have purchased virtually. This is helpful to keep track of events that where not solicited by the user but rather by invitation.

title: Have been using this software for years.
name: Donald A.
pros: Pros: Ability to sell tickets over a wide audience. Easy to upload mailing list. Helps maintain a customer database.
cons: Cons: Fee structure and processing. Fees for events never remain consistent. And there should be a way for fees to be deducted at time of purchase as opposed to later via invoice.
overall: Overall: easy to use ticketing software with html links.

title: Handles registration without fuss
name: Adam C.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is very easy to set up and help organize registration for a meeting or conference. It has lots of functionality and control. For example, you can set special ticket type, make tickets available or unavailable at specific times/dates, set promo codes for speakers or discounts (e.g. for students). Payment processing is done by Eventbrite and then transferred electronically to an account you indicate. Fees are quite low and easily incorporated into ticket price (which you can choose to be visible or not to the end user). Very intuitive. You can be up and running in no time.
cons: Cons: Eventbrite usually only pays out after your event. So if you are counting on the money from pre-ticket sales to be in your account prior to event - this is not the right option.

title: Because a party without people is just sad
name: Osa L.
pros: Pros: When you have an event or a cause and you need to get people's attention, you need to get people to come and participate, then Eventbrite is one of the easiest platforms you can use. Not only will your event be posted online, but it will also be easily searchable by google so that if people search for something that your event covers on google then your event can pop up. Better yet, people often go to eventbrite just looking for events to participate in, and when they see your event, they may decide to attend even if they were never even looking for your event.
cons: Cons: Eventbrite has access to your contact list, and some people may not be comfortable registering with eventbrite because they don't want their information being too publicly available. In that case you can probably provide multiple options for registering for your event.

title: Eventbrite
name: Verified Reviewer
pros:
Pros: - easy to use

- support for beginners (those who are using the software for the first time)

- free (if you have no event registration fees)

- great tool to have if managing simple events
cons:
Cons: - as soon as you create the event, it becomes public. I once had a speaker event created for my students (and it was a free event); and I had 3 external to school people signing up for it. Took me some time to go over the RSVP list to make sure nobody else external was there.

- not a very helpful tool if you event has multiple sessions/registration tracks/etc.

- very limited customization options
overall: Overall: My overall experience with Eventbrite has been good. It is perfect for and easy to use when managing smaller simple events. It also looks professional.

title: have only used as a comsumer, not an event promoter yet
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: It is everywhere--everyone knows what it is and what it does, and most events that sell tickets use evertbrite to sell and promote their ticket sales. IT is easy, straightforward, and very accessible. The best feature is it is all online, instead of requiring one to leave home or stand in a line to purchase event tickets.
cons: Cons: I can't think of anything negative. I would like to utilize the software at some point for an event of my own, but I will have to study up on how to schedule and promote through them.
overall: Overall: so far, I have only purchased tickets through this technology, but I intend to utilize its awesome potential on future sales events of my artwork and writing. It is clearly the dominant choice for ticket sales and event promo.

title: Really can't be equalled
name: Mark H.
pros: Pros: Easy to use, with generous free functionality.
cons: Cons: Slightly limited functions from app, inability to modify number of people in a booking.
overall: Overall: Overall Eventbrite is a fantastic system - I used it for about two years to take bookings for a college training restaurant, and the free account did everything we needed, including customised forms for food choices, allergies etc and producing nice readable reports for our chefs and front of house. Only frustration is the inability to modify number of people in a booking without deleting it and starting again.

title: Easiest way to get me to attend an event.
name: Olayinka A.
pros:
Pros: I am one who is a bit disorganized ,thus on so many occasions ; I have been invited to events and I end up misplacing my invitation card and find it difficult asking the organizer for another.

Eventbrite has basically come handy for me. With Eventbrite ,I am able to register for events and get sent an invite to my mail. Since it isn't possible to lose my email account ,I never get to bother about loosing my invitation.As I am able to print it at anytime and as many times as possible.
overall: Overall: Nothing ,it ticks all of my expectation and has never failed me at anytime. I feel it is the way to go for event organizers ,personally.

title: Good Product For Events
name: Angela W.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is an easy to use platform that allows you to list your event and take payment. I like that it is simple to setup for us and simple to use for the user. As a user, I have signed up for several events with no fuss.
cons: Cons: Although I do love that it's simple, you don't have many options when it comes to design and making it feel like your brand. Other event companies we have used allowed for more customization. But really, in the end, people don't seem to care and a lot of our clients are used to this platform. They also recently changed their pay structure which wasn't as ideal as before but I imagine they had to make the decision as they were giving away a lot for free before.

title: User Friendly
name: Sarah M.
pros: Pros: This is one of the most easy to use apps around. Everything is self explanatory. There are lots of great events to pick from. Everything is organized and location is automatically set from your phone
cons: Cons: What I enjoy least about this app is that not all events happening in the area are on here. That is about the only thing
overall: Overall: I really enjoy this app. It has been ingrowing for the last few years and it has became into something really great. Everything is organized and put into whichever topic you may enjoy. Only downfall is that not all events happening in the town are on there but it is what it is. I highly recommend using this app for fun stuff. I have purchased many tickets off from it and everything is secure and easy to use.

title: Slick Ticketing Platform
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is a great solution for easy ticket management. They do an incredible job tracking data and generating reports to help you really dig in to your event.
cons: Cons: There are some annoying pieces of functionality with this software like administrative management that aren't incredibly intuitive.

title: SO GREAT
name: Megan C.
pros:
Pros: Eventbrite is so easy to use. I've never actually posted on Eventbrite, but I use it regularly. It's the best events site I've ever used. It's super easy to navigate and find cool events happening in my area. I've visited other event sites, but none of them are as user-friendly as Eventbrite. With other sites, my ticket always gets lost and it's SO hard to find it, but with Eventbrite it's always really easy to find.

If I see venues/performers/events using Eventbrite as their platform to sell tickets, I'm always more inclined to go because I know that purchasing tickets will be easy and hassle-free.
cons: Cons: Honestly nothing, it's so easy to use and convenient.

title: Better than all the rest
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: I think Eventbrite is better than all other event softwares online. It's super easy, it integrates perfectly with Facebook and mail chimp. I use it will every event I create. The app for scanning tickets and payment is great. I can edit and create events with the mobile app which isn't great for on the go, plus it's practically free to use.
cons: Cons: The only con I can across was Recently when I tried to update my tickets start and end date. I opened the Eventbrite app and was unable to edit ticket info, so I logging on directly to site from my phone and then I was able to make changes. Maybe there's a glitch or I don't know where to look

title: Fantastic Way to Organize and Promote Events
name: Kate W.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is a great tool for small to medium size organizations who need to set up an event. Once the event is created is is super easy to share, promote and keep track of sales. I love that I can use the software from my laptop as well as my phone using the Eventbrite organizer app.
cons: Cons: Setting up an event can be tricky, especially if you are trying to set up more than one type of ticket, and it takes a little bit of time to get through to customer service if you need them.
overall: Overall: We have used Eventbrite for 6 years to set up an annual event, and once we got past the learning curve on that first setup it has been smooth sailing! I love being able to login from anywhere on my phone and keep track of the ticket sales.

title: Highly Recommend for Events!
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: What I really like about Eventbrite is how easy it is to create events. Whether it be a paid event or a free event, the whole process of creating and listing an event on the site and then getting people to register is an extremely seamless process. I have used Eventbrite to organize one school event and it was great because we were able to get a general idea of how many people we were expecting to show up!
cons: Cons: There's definitely not a lot of ways that Eventbrite can get your event a lot of attention unless you share it on social media. For small events, this can be particularly hard to get attention from people that may not be in your immediate network. I think Eventbrite definitely needs to work on how to better improve how events can be promoted.
overall: Overall: My overall experience with Eventbrite has been great and I would highly reccomend for others to give it a try. I know that whether it be a corporate or nonprofit, many other organizations have found it to be extremely useful as well.

title: The best event management tool out there for most occasions
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: The ability to set up both complex and easy events, with relatively no effort and all options that I'd like, is almost amazing.
cons: Cons: There have been almost no occasions when I have been upset with Eventbrite.
overall: Overall: Overall, everything about Eventbrite has been amazing and I can't say a bad thing about it.

title: After trialing lots of online ticketing agencies, I won't use anyone but Eventbrite
name: Christine F.
comments: Comments: There are a number of reasons I prefer Eventbrite to other companies. Besides the required 'ease of use' and 'intuitive design' of their site I have to honestly say that I like all the controls the platform gives me. I can easily create different ticket options, discount codes, tracking links, invitations (which also allow me to invite attendees of previous events I've hosted on the platform) and can manually add any users (such as comp tickets for media) to the system without incurring any fees. I can also easily repeat an event with one click, which saves any custom tickets or pricing and also allows for easy updates. Their integration with social media is helpful, and they are always making updates to their offerings. They also have promotional tools to help you reach an audience outside of your usual base. The nonprofit organization I work for has conducted over 70 parties, tours, classes, etc with Eventbrite, and I consider them a partner in helping us produce great events and helping me raise money for our educational programs. I also appreciate that they are growing as a company. I never feel that their 'resting on their laurels' when it comes to the design of the site or the tools offered. Even after working with them for a number of years, I still call tech support to get questions answered if I can't figure it out quickly on my own, and their staff is helpful and nice. All in all I give them an A+. They make my job easier, and I would recommend them to anyone looking for an online ticketing company.

title: Best platform for attendees AND organizers
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: Not many platforms have incredible functionality for both sides of the house, but Eventbrite is an exception to that. From easy to manage organizer features and reporting options, to easy to find events and reminders for when they're coming up, Eventbrite helps me feel connected to the places I am, and helps me connect with the people where I'm hosting events!
cons: Cons: I wish there were some more page customization options, as well as date options (for example to let someone know that the event occurs across three days, each day 9-3, but that it's one event, not three separate events) has been a struggle for us.

title: Staying in touch with your community
name: Emily B.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is the easiest way for me to see whats currently going on in my community in regards to social events. I live in the Miami, FL area and it has been a life saver when not knowing where to go with friends. The events are always well described and not too expensive. The app is also extremely easy to use.
cons: Cons: My only con for Eventbrite is the fact that it doesn't have a counter for how many people have bought tickets to an events so you don't really know how big an event is til you arrive. I also know of a few friends that have bought tickets to a none existent event at a random location.
overall: Overall: Overall Eventbrite is a great way to stay in touch with your community and participate in all sort of events in your area, but you do have to look out for fraud and maybe look more into an event before buying a ticket.

title: Love the functionality, do not love the fees
name: Barb K.
pros: Pros: We love that we can use Eventbrite for all of our tickets to our various events. It's easy to set up, share, and track. We can also download our attendee list in order to email them through our email software. There are excellent statistics and information that we can use to compare events and year over year results.
cons: Cons: The fees continue to increase, so on some ticketed events we only receive about 65% of the gross sales. The app only shows gross sales, so we have to remember to do the math to see our actual net income. We often pass the fees on to our attendees, but in some cases that inhibits ticket sales.

title: Good tool for ticketing
name: Emanuela C.
pros: Pros: I used Eventbrite to sell tickets for a business conference. It is pretty easy to use and quick to set up. Payments are based on tickets sold, so you pay only if you sell tickets. Free tickets are not charged. It is possible to create different types of tickets, hide some special tickets (and give a special code to give the access only to some people) and create discount codes. I embedded the ticketing widget on my event website so attendees were able to buy tickets without leaving my site.
cons: Cons: The fees applied to the tickets are a bit expensive. The confirmation email should have a customizable template to fit with my company's guidelines.

title: Event Management Made Easy
name: Kristin C.
comments: Comments: Overall, we have been very happy with the Eventbrite platform and will continue using it for our event ticketing and advertising needs.
pros: Pros: I love using Eventbrite to manage ticketing for my events. It has a user friendly platform, handles all payments/refunds, and has reasonable fees. Eventbrite has also become a go to destination for finding events to attend in my area.
cons: Cons: It would always be nice to have no fees, but we understand that this is a necessary part of business and the longevity of the program. One time we had a problem with transferring of funds to our account after the event was over as they have set times they do this. It was semi-inconvenient but not a deal breaker.

title: Best Event Software
name: Anne L.
pros: Pros: I really enjoyed how easy it was to use this software. I have used this many times during my time as a college student at Cal. Most events hosted by student groups at Cal use Eventbrite for ticketing. Our organization used Eventbrite to host multiple clubbing events in SF and to collect ticket sales. I enjoyed how there are referral links/codes to help track ticket sales from other organizations helping us sell tickets.
cons: Cons: I did not really have a problem with the software. I do wish that there was more customizability for event pages though so it can really pop and stand out.
overall: Overall: I enjoyed my experience.

title: Eventbrite Review
name: Mackenzie F.
comments: Comments: Eventbrite has been our event registration platform for a few years. It's very easy to use and has great reporting, dashboard, etc. We are a member organization and would benefit from Eventbrite integrating with a CRM which it currently doesn't do.
pros: Pros: Nice dashboard, easy reporting.
cons: Cons: Customer service is hard to reach and sometimes it can be slow.

title: Great product
name: Kirsten R.
pros: Pros: Really easy to use and integrates well with my other products. The spreadsheets and data collected is fantastic.
cons: Cons: It takes a little bit to get used to where everything is. Some tools are in strange spots, but once you figure it out it is a breeze.
overall: Overall: Easier ticket sales

title: Good name recognition, not the easiest to use
name: Liz A.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is one of the better known platforms for invites if you are hosting an event. You can set up alerts to automatically email your guest list reminders to RSVP, to attend, etc. It is easy to register outside users who may not have used the platform before.
cons: Cons: Not always the most user friendly. It can take a while to figure out all the features, and can be tedious triple checking that all the emails are set up correctly. Emails can also be filtered into the wrong folders in many emails platforms.
overall: Overall: I have used Eventbrite several times to send out invites for events I was hosting at work. It had the name recognition to keep people less than skeptical of the event.

title: Eventbrite provides us free advertizement.
name: Oyinlola H.
pros:

I haven't used any other website since discovering Eventbrite!

There seems to be a good number of folks who are already familiar with this systems which makes things more efficient all around. It won't disappoint!

title: One of the best event management tools
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is an easy to use ticketing platform. Its user interface is very intuitive and allows the creation of a smooth experience for users going through the event registration and ticket purchase process. The tool has advanced features which allow automation of event reminders, application of coupons, site embedding, and integration with google maps. I simply love this tool.
cons: Cons: I cannot really point out any flaws with this tool's event creation functionality. It does a really great job in that regard, but one thing I do not like is that EventBrite has an event discovery feature, which lists other events listed on Eventbrite. I view that as a distraction for our end users as it can affect the attendance of our own event.
overall: Overall: We use this annually to invite customers to our customer summit. As the person tasked with setting this up, I find the tool intuitive and easy to use. It offers me considerable flexibility in designing an event with numerous choices which make event set up real easy.

title: Makes setting up event registration a breeze!
name: Lauren L.
pros: Pros: I love that it's a one stop shop for event registration. You've got your professionally designed event page, guests can pay for the event right there, print their tickets, and on the back end there's an abundance of analytics, records, and receipts that I don't have to worry about because it's all there.
cons: Cons: This is just a little thing (and might be fixable) but in the event dashboard, when I want to look at past events, I wish it went in the order of most recent event down than first to last. As we continue to add more events, I'm more interested in easily accessing analytics from our last event.
overall: Overall: We have been easily able to set up a recurring weekly event registration with ease through Eventbrite. It probably took me 30 minutes to set everything up including payment options.

title: Use this all the time!
name: Brittany A.
pros: Pros: It's so simple and easy to search for and buy tickets for events near me, or when I visit other places.
cons: Cons: Honestly the fees for tickets, but I mean there's no tax so.
overall: Overall: I like eventbrite because it's really easy to search for upcoming and and future events. You can find events happening today, tomorrow or within the next month. You can also search for events pretty much where ever you are and are travelling too. I also love that there's free events and very easy to rsvp to them. The website is very easy to use and everything is clear to see. The app is also very easy to use as well. I haven't created an event on there yet. But when I do have a need too I will definitely use eventbrite for my event needs.

title: Great software, not as powerful as I thought it would be
name: William B.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: I love the way eventbrite looks. When attendees arrive at the site, they get a very professional presentation. Up until Cvents recent visual update, this was the best looking software in the game. It's also very easy to use. So if your staff are not experienced event planners, it's no problem! They could learn this extremely quickly.
cons: Cons: I thought it was the best in the business, but it has a lot less flexibility than Cvent and Regonline. Eventbrite is based off of a ticketing paradigm. Since it's a ticket, some advanced options are not available. One problem we run into is that we apply discount codes. If you apply a 100% discount code (someone gets to attend for free, happens all the time), it will cancel the ticket! So then we as event planners have to go back in and re-register people or have them do it themselves. Customer service doesn't have any great solutions for this problem either.

title: wonderful, interactive, creative displays
name: Hannah P.
pros: Pros: I really like how Eventbrite can connect event organizers and attendees so well. There are so many opportunities to interact with and message attendees, which is really helpful when there are updates. I particularly like how Eventbrite automatically sent reminder emails to attendees 48 hours prior to the event, with an option to download or print tickets.
cons: Cons: Eventbrite works very well, but does seem a bit pricey in comparison to other similar softwares. I have never had a problem with Eventbrite, so I guess I am getting what I pay for, but I just wish it was not so expensive.

title: Changed and is now expensive for nonprofits
name: Grace B.
position: Director of Development and Community Relations
pros: Pros: We liked that is walks you through step by step when creating events. With it being so popular, everyone knows how to use it too.
cons: Cons: I believe in 2018 they changed their policy and are now taking a larger percentage of profits from the event. As a nonprofit event planner, the percentage they were taking from ticket sales seemed unreasonable. We encourage people to purchase tickets in advance because it helps us plan the event, but we were only getting about 80% of the ticket price and out donors wanted to know why so we switched to a fundraising platform rather than an event platform.

title: Easy of use
name: Giti Z.
pros: Pros: My school uses Eventbrite and thus, I sign up for events using this app. It is a simple app and very easy to use. When booking events, the app requests one to enter name, email and the number of people attending. There is no hassle. The booking is then confirmed and one can save the ticket and/or share it on social media. It has great features such as promoting, tracking and checking-in. It also offers a secure online payment option, which is easy to utilize.
cons: Cons: Nothing I dislike. As an attendee to many events on campus, I can only talk about the features I have used. Thus far, I could not be happier with Eventbrite. It allows me to organize the events I would like to attend and have all my tickets in one place.

title: Eventbrite makes event promotion and ticket sales easy
name: KRYSTAL K.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is very easy to use. It is an easy tool to use to sell tickets and it is pretty straight forward to set up events on Eventbrite and promote them online and via email.
cons: Cons: The cost of using the service could be seen as a downside when there are other ways to sell tickets that are free (minus credit card or paypal fees). You also receive the fee and then pay Eventbrite, as opposed to the fee directly going to Eventbrite when someone buys a ticket.
overall: Overall: Eventbrite's interface is clean and simple, and figuring out how to customize your event listing is fairly easy. It is also easy to go back in and edit and event. You can export all the registrations into a spreadsheet for easy check in for ticket holders. Eventbrite also helps boost your event because of the search engine optimization and Eventbrite's own tools. Eventbrite will recommend events based on your region or social contacts, thus encouraging more registrations. Yes the service is not free, but it is worth the cost and saves time in terms of registering people and promoting your events.

title: Great company to work with!
name: Angie W.
pros: Pros: Easy to set up race registrations and easy access to participant data.
cons: Cons: I only wish we could set it up so people can sign up for multiple events at once.
overall: Overall: Eventbrite is awesome. We've been using it for years and continue to find great success with it.

title: Eventbrite: The DEFAULT STANDARD!

Having said that it has enough bells and whistles for you to put out exactly what you need to schedule, Invite and Register people for an Event!

title: Making Events Great Again
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: A few things. It is pretty easy to set up; in fact, it's kind of hard to screw it up! The whole idea of ticket distribution and money collection is taken care of quite nicely. I can also easily see how many tickets have been purchased, who has purchased, everything that you need in an easy, simple dashboard. I have used it in a variety of settings with never a problem.
cons: Cons: Occasionally, creating event posts leads to nowhere. Once or twice, I've had issues with adding in location or editing the description, that sort of thing. Considering the payout and distribution is seamless, it's a pretty small price to be for that. I think my issues may have been more of an anomaly.
overall: Overall: The collection of funds and the ease of registration make it well worth it. The old-fashioned way of hard tickets at the door is cumbersome for large events - this tells me what I need to know well before the event begins. I also love anything that collects data, such as addresses. Use it, for sure!

title: Popular for Good Reason
name: Sarah Ruth O.
pros: Pros: I like that this software is so often used in my area for small events like little workshops to large scale events like music festivals. I like that it feels like your getting tickets to something more private in contrast to ticketing software that is so publicly viewed such as Ticketmaster. I like that this is software that any person can use to get work out about their event, it gives it a very "local" feel.
cons: Cons: Given the nature of the local-feel, if you are simply pointed to the site because you have an event you want to go to and the link to tickets leads you there, its great. But I think as a standalone app, its not an excellent choice for browsing events as a lot of the ones that turn up are not narrowed down by interest as much as other apps in its category.
overall: Overall: I notice that all of the local events in my town use Eventbrite for their ticket sales -- they tend to be small music venues, dance nights, classes, workshops and similar.

title: Known

Their navigation system of looking for events seems fairly intuitive as well and if one is having a casual browse, the app does well in serving that.
cons: Cons: While surfing the application casually can be easy, if one is looking for information in a pinch about an event, it can be a little difficult to find. Many events have to create special rules outside of the app in order to work around what the app lacks.

title: A Useful Program for Organizing Events
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: This software helps to organize events. You can invite people and create a space for information. It is widely used among many businesses. It is easy to find information and RSVP to events you are invited to, and it allows syncronization with Google Calendars to automatically add the event to your calendar.
cons: Cons: As an end user, Eventbrite can be confusing and cumbersome. It also feels archaic and restricted to web. I am unaware of any mobile access or app for the service. It also has a reputation of being very business heavy and does not lend itself to social gatherings outside of business.

title: Effective way to manage communities and events
name: Ozan O.

It's easy to see and participate in upcoming events related to your interests. It is also nice to be able to share your views after and before the event as a participant. Thanks to Eventbrite's reputation, as a community administrator, you can easily incorporate many people into your community on any topic.
cons: Cons: It needs to have a free version, especially for non-profit organizations and schools. Many communities are being shut down for lack of financial support.
overall: Overall: I use Eventbrite to keep track of events of interest to me and to build communities. It allows me to meet many new people and establish new collaborations.

title: I will never miss out on an event again

We have also used it to promote our company events and the reach is great, depending on the topics it is even better than social media.

pros: Pros: I love how you can easily put in your event, and discover other events in the neighborhood. Pretty straight forward.

name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: My company plans events all around the world. As a result, we've tried out pretty much every event software out there. Eventbrite is by far the easiest there is to set up, use and manage. It especially makes the event easy the day of, as their app and swiping ability let us move long lines quickly.
cons: Cons: For our more complex events - especially ones that have multiple lodging options - there's just no way to set them up how we need using Eventbrite. As such, we have to use multiple event apps, depending on the complexity of our event.

title: Eventbrite
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: As an administrator, I can view the number of people who wanted to purchase event tickets.

overall: Overall: Eventbrite is very manageable from an administrator perspective. It is easy to use and there are shareable links so people can find your events.

title: Great for hosting events!
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is truly wonderful. It makes it super easy to host an event, and even easier for guests to register. Also, it helps with check in the day of the event. We can easily track who did attend. It also has simple integration with social media.
cons: Cons: Nothing. Eventbrite is wonderful, and so far I haven't had any issues.
overall: Overall: Five stars!

title: Nice if you have the money
name: Ken K.
position: Elementary School Principal - Park Community Charter and Victor Haen Elementary Schools
pros: Pros: Eventbrite looks great and connects your event with social media very easily.
cons: Cons: It is too expensive. As a charter school we used this product for two years to promote and gather registrations for our golf outing and Run/Walk/Bike events. It did what we wanted but the fees just became too much. We have moved to another product with less frills appearance wise but actually more features that has saved our school significant money over Eventbrite.
overall: Overall: The product was good to work with but it seemed like every feature we needed to add was more off of our profit margin for events that we could not afford to lose.

title: Solid Event and Ticketing App
name: Jared D.
pros: Pros: I love the simply design, layout and functionality of Eventbrite. They have some great integrations and it's so simply to setup an Eventbrite page. An added benefit is their promotional channels they use to send info out to local email lists about upcoming events. It's essentially free publicity.
cons: Cons: Eventbrite is great for free events, however their rates are a bit high for ticketed events.
overall: Overall: Overall, I really enjoy Eventbrite and definitely recommend it for free events. If you're a nonprofit that has ticketed events and needs to cut costs, I might consider looking at another tool such as TicketSpice.

title: Eventbrite in a Nutshell
name: Maddy B.
pros: Pros: We mainly used for partner events when we want a third party ownership of the event. It is also used when we want to have multi-day programs because the architecture of the offerings is better than our house built system.

title: Easy to use and comprehensive event management

It give the event a place to live online if you don't have your own website to use. The reports are easy to generate for lists of guests and revenue, and the money collected is easily transferred to your bank account.
cons: Cons: I love how easy it is to use. You can set up a great event page and sell tickets in a matter of minutes.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Eventbrite is one of the easiest event management tools I have come across. I have seen much fancier software that can end up cluttered and hard to manage. This does it all without the confusion.

title: Great networking and information sharing
name: Natalie W.
pros: Pros: Although I have not yet used this software to create an event yet, I have used it to source events and book spaces to attend. It's a great resource, you can search for events local to you and in categories to suit, we work with young people and check this site regularly to see if anything is happening locally to us that would be good to attend to learn and network with like minded people. Your tickets for the events you have booked are stored on your phone with a code, its great!!!so you dont even have to remember where they are
cons: Cons: I have no negatives as this site even has free events to attend and I have never had any issues with events I have booked
overall: Overall: Networking and learning opportunities local to us

title: A robust and solid event management tool with a suite full of functions and customizations
name: Zach P.
pros: Pros: The fact that Eventbrite provides both a landing page and seamless ticket purchasing experience with a free option for non-paid events makes it a must-use tool for non-profit event management. The platform to design the event and set rules and ticket specifications is incredibly simple and having a built-in guest list function is great for managing all the names and +1s for guests. The ability to also collect emails to notify attendees of event information is very useful.
cons: Cons: If you're using Eventbrite for paid ticketing the 3.5% + fees rate can seem a bit hefty, especially if you're passing it along to the consumer to pay for. Unfortunately, this is a reality of buying tickets online where the fees tend to stack up pretty quickly.
overall: Overall: Eventbrite is my go-to solution for any small to medium sized event. I have nothing but praise for how simple Eventbrite makes the entire event process.

title: The future is Event-brite!
name: Lindsey H.
pros: Pros: The familiarity. I am constantly looking at the upcoming events in my city, both personal and professional. When I see that the tickets are sold through Eventbrite, I know the event is legit. It's comforting to fully trust a company and know that your money is going exactly where you think it is going. It's nice to know it's not a scam!
cons: Cons: I really do not have any critiques to this software. It is a comprehensive and easy to use software that does exactly what I want it to. Who could ask for more?
overall: Overall: As I stated above, it gives me ease of mind. I know I can trust Eventbrite, and I know my money is going to it's intended place and I won't get scammed. It's not easy to find that comfort on the internet these days!

title: An excellent platform for business events and launches
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: Simple to set up an event, integration with facebook, simple ticketing, and a good dashboard to view RSVP status. Good reflexive event page interface is great for mobile ticket purchases. They also have the option of creating a private event or a public event to control exposure when attendance is limited. Public events are listed on their website if exposure and advertising is desired.
cons: Cons: Design options to match the look and feel of a business's branding are limited for the event page.
overall: Overall: It is a simple way to create, share, and market an event for a business.

title: Great For No-Cost Ticketing
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: I use Eventbrite frequently for my business when I want to have a tracking website that's a bit more professional and polished than a simple Facebook event page. Eventbrite pages also integrate with Facebook, so you can still share and market your event seamlessly! I enjoy using this website b/c my clients receive my call to action (you're invited, please RSVP), without having to pay for a ticket (if I choose), but they still go through the steps of signing up for a ticket, hopefully giving a greater sense of commitment and obligation to attend, vice just clicking "yes" or "no" on a FB event, which is highly noncommittal.
cons: Cons: I haven't yet mastered how to keep an event private but still have it come up in searches on Eventbrite. I wanted my clients to be able to search for the event (in addition to having the link, you know - cover ALL possibilities), but the only way I could make my event searchable, was to make it public - open to all.
overall: Overall: Highly satisfied! Eventbrite is a regular tool for me as a business owner!

title: Great Marketing Tool

cons: Cons: The free version gives you limited usage and if you want help, you have to pay. But other than that, is a great tool for marketing. 100% recommended.

title: I love Eventbrite
name: rahul c.

cons: Cons: I don't get reminders notifications for the event. They should add that functionality in their mobile app.

title: Easy Interface to Setup Events
name: Verified Reviewer

You can publish and unpublish events easily. Plus you can even check people in and see the metrics on your dashboard post event.
cons: Cons: Nothing. I like the platform and the cost is very minimal for what you receive.
overall: Overall: My experiences when I used it to create some small Realtor events for work was great. The emails that were sent looked professional. I was a happy camper using this software. I believe the cost is very fair.

title: Works great

cons: Cons: I dislike having the system create tickets for every event no matter what. We've hosted events before that we wanted an rsvp for but we didn't need people to show tickets to attend. It made it confusing for them and more frustrating than it needed to be for us.
overall: Overall: We publicize events and gather rsvps for attendance.

title: Initial Impressions are Positive
name: Jack H.
comments: Comments: I've not really run it through its paces, but after my initial use, I'm willing to continue to use it. That's not to say I might not run into things I hate, but so far, so good.
pros: Pros: I've used EventBrite now for 3 free events. It's easy to create the event and to create a great looking landing page with the tool. I like the options it provides for specifying and then tracking the number of tickets claimed. It seems pretty easy and intuitive for the user on both desktop and mobile platforms.
cons: Cons: I hate the fees charged for ticket handling. But I don't know any way around it. I haven't done a paid event yet with EventBrite, but the fees look to be the typically outrageous "handling fees" that ticket brokers charge. I accept the reality that these folks aren't working for free, but it is really irritating to see a 10% or even 20% premium added to the cost of the ticket for "surcharges and handling." Yech.

title: The Event Shall Be...Bright
name: Aquirra RoEve L.

The software is super easy to navigate, and as soon as you launch the home page you will be greeted with tons of info about upcoming events in your area, and around the country. If you download the app its a quick process, and a good place to store your tickets that have already been purchased, which helps if you are an eco-friendly person and want to cut down on paper usage.
cons: Cons: I don't have any qualms with the technicalities of the software, I think the color of the app is eye catching, but I wish that there was more of a pronounced design on the app, from an artists point of view.

title: Helps me plan my private events better.
name: Shola A.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite has made it easy for us at my workplace to get professionals signed-up for our quarterly developer meetup.Personally for times I have organized private events like birthday parties ; this program has helped me in estimating the number of people likely to turn up for my event, thus ensuring I am able to plan near accurately.
cons: Cons: I dislike the fact that random strangers can somewhat stumble on my event and get an invite ,without actually being invited.

title: It is very easy to use
name: Annette G.
pros: Pros: It is very easy to use and advertise any events to local people. Having contact information on file and one-click emailing makes it way easier for people to get in communication with me if there are any queries
cons: Cons: I cannot think of any negatives for eventbrite except that advertising is kind of little expensive for every ticket as there is % + per ticket sold price + credit card processing fee which makes it to about 20% but it is worth it for the advertising we get

title: Great product, but most intergrations don't work in Australia
name: Caitlin P.
comments: Comments: Great product, ease to use and set up events. Inter rates with mailchimmp and Wordpress relitively easily. But if your in Australia you automatically loose out on over half the intergrations available. None of the NFP charity intergrations are good if your outside of the US, Canada is the exception to this rule with a few providers. I enquired about some of the new features they have been aludding to recently on their website, Particularly fundraising intergrations for event participants to collect sponsorship for their event, well customer service was quick to help but despit stressing I was from Australia and they would need to be able to offer their services here but also except an Australian Charity status, they just referred me to intergrations that did neither . Over all great product but feel like I'm missing out with the intergrations.
pros: Pros: Easy to use, setup or booking.
cons: Cons: Intergrations are only for the US, forget about using any of the NFP if your not from the States.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Basic events, great. Looking for an integrated platform, do some research first particularly if your outside of the US.

title: Great Way to Host an Event
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: I like that Eventbrite is very user friendly. The options are all laid out for you and thought through (such as charging tax, promo codes, etc.). This tool works really well for my company because the event we host annually for our users is less than 100 people, so Eventbrite is an easy, somewhat cheaper option for us.
cons: Cons: There aren't many options (at least with the subscription we have) to design the look of the event page. Eventbrite also limits things like number of ticket types you can have depending on your subscription. The reporting tools of past events are a little limited/confusing as well.
overall: Overall: Works for what we need it to. I'm excited to see how our customers interact with our upcoming event on Eventbrite!

title: Free and Easy
name: Trish W.
pros: Pros: It was really easy to create our events, add banner photos, set up automatic email response with location. It even sends out reminders prior to the events. Is is app friendly so you can scan the tickets too. And, it's a great way to collect client contact information for mailing list too. Some software can be so overly complicated and Eventbrite didn't do that. They gave you everything you needed, for free, in a very intuitive setup.
cons: Cons: I did not have any dislikes about this software. It was incredibly easy to use.

title: Eventbrite review
name: Edward A.
pros: Pros: The amount of differents free events that the app have and the interface is very user-friendly. You can even post your own events and is really easy.
cons: Cons: Don't really works as you desire outside United States for example in the Caribbean
overall: Overall: If you plan to have a conference is really easy to put your event in this application.

title: Helpful Way to Share Event Information and Track Responses.
name: Jennifer O.
pros: Pros: It filled the need we had to provide easy registration links (and maps etc.). We don't require tickets or payment for the events for which we use it. We like that our target audience recognize the name of the software and trust it to RSVP. We also like automatic reminders it sends to those who have registered
cons: Cons: We did run into some confusion last year for our series of choral reading sessions where the same person was registered multiple times, causing us to expect a larger crowd than actually planned to attend. We assumed it was a user issue -- that they planned to bring a friend or two but chose not to provide specific names. However, it was actually a system glitch. As we use the free version, there was a little bit of difficulty at first when trying to get the issue resolved, but their support team was ultimately helpful.
overall: Overall: It works well for our registration tracking needs, provides easy-to-share links, and sends helpful reminders and directions to attendees.

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
name: Sheryl K.
pros: Pros: I love that we can easily send out invitations to special groups of clients. For returning events we use this feature a lot as well as the event check-in which makes the planning process event simpler!
cons: Cons: They make everyone create an account for events and I wish there were more ready-to-use templates available.

title: Reasonable price, and good customer service
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: Their fees aren't bad, and I feel like they understand that they are used by businesses of all sizes. We use Eventbrite for ticket sales on one event every year, and I wouldn't use any other system. It's easy to customize how tickets are issued and easy to refund tickets. No problems whatsoever. I had some questions, and called customer service once. I was so relieved to speak to someone and get the problem figured out immediately.
cons: Cons: I wish it was a little bit cheaper with its fees, but they gotta make a living!

title: Look no further for your event management system
name: Desiree R.
pros: Pros: Incredibly easy to use. Makes collecting payments for events a no brainer.
cons: Cons: I wish it integrated better into Salesforce and website calendars.

title: Better than most even management platforms, but not the best
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: This platform is one of the most used event platforms, so the user experience (for ticket buyers) is simple and easy for them. Building your event is easy and enables you to create a launch an event within 10 minutes. It's great to use for small sized events, but for larger events the payout process can become a pain. It has great widget items that you can embed like a countdown clock or ticket buyer.
cons: Cons: The new embed feature they use is not compatible with all CMS. If your CMS does not work well with iFrames, you'll have to do 4 extra steps in the creation process in order to use the classic embed code. The map of where the event is located can be glitchy and not show up at all. If you're using the free version, you payout is sent after you event has occurred unless you can have support change it without a fee. There isn't an Eventbrite Wordpress plugin, which would be great as well.
overall:
Overall: - Simple to use

- Seamless user experience

- Safe to use for transactional functions

- Great support with great follow through

title: My new favorite event registration tool
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: This sophisticated event marketing and registration tool is easy to use and track attendees. In addition, Eventbrite will help you collect money for registration, register people at the door and market your event to the public.
cons: Cons: I wish Eventbrite would take their money from the payments directly vs the user having to return after an event and pay the final bill. Just seems like an extra unnecessary step.
overall: Overall: Cost Value - Their cost is spot on and its one of the best event registration and marketing tools out there.

title: Find every day something to have fun
name: Federica V.
pros: Pros: I love the fact you can easily input your location, and Eventbrite always finds a lot of great alternatives and events near you. Some of the time, it is helpful not only in finding a location but it is inspiring and give amazing ideas/different options than usual!
cons: Cons: I don't like the fact you are not able to share the event via certain apps (such as WhatsApp) and that some of the times the price for the specific event is not extremely clear.
overall: Overall: Since I started using Eventbrite I started having so many more options for my nights out. I always have some ideas in mind that I can share with my friends and even if we are not enough motivated to find good fun activities Eventbrite does it for us.

title: Easy to Host Events
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is super simple to use, and allows a lot of features even for free events without paying a dime for their service. That said, they handle all invoicing and payments, etc, for a pretty fair fee structure.
cons: Cons: They offer reporting on nearly everything, which is great. That said, it's not super intuitively organized, so I've, on multiple occasions, had to search around for specific data points before I found them.
overall: Overall: Overall, I think their service is awesome and handles almost all of the administration for hosting both free and paid events.

title: Consistently a fast expereince
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: The only reason I breath a little sign of relief when I am trying to rush through an event sign up is when I see it's been created by eventbrite. I know that the fields can be autofilled and the event confirmations are easy to find later. I used to attend a ton of meetups and events, while it was never too difficult to get signed up. Often the whole process of entering the same data made we want to quite by the second field. It shouldn't take me half an hour to get through this because I'm looking for spending the least amount of time possible. It's been seamless and fast in my experience.
cons: Cons: I once tried to use the platform to find local events that were in my area... that was a mistake. The groupings are difficult to navigate, many events were completely off, the locations I was searching in weren't displaying in a map format, etc. This software isn't for discovery as much as it is for confirmations and organizing.

title: Eventbrite
name: Karman W.
pros: Pros: I use Eventbrite to post all my work related events that needs to get out to the general public. This platform allows me to do so very seamlessly. Since I work for a government agency, all software that use must be free, so this work out perfectly.
cons: Cons: I do not like that I can not add my companies logo (or perhaps I have not figured that part out). I would like the option to personalize the event page as much as possible, but all for free since the agency I work for does not have a budget for this type platform.

title: Eventbrite helps us run small local events as well as a massive world-wide.
name: Brent P.
comments: Comments: I highly recommend Eventbrite.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is great because it allows us to collect payment, registration, and issue tickets for several types of events. We use Eventbrite for small events of 10 or so attendees, medium sized events of 50-80 people and large complex, expensive events.
cons: Cons: Eventbrite doesn't have a ton of flexibility when it comes to designing the main page of our events. They do allow us to add a custom graphic or photo, but there are limitations to other parts of the look.

title: Great Event Organizer
name: Gigi J.
pros: Pros: It's really easy to set up and use. Makes tracking ticket sales and attendance super easy. We've been primarily using it for free events, so that's a perk as well.
cons: Cons: It can be a bit complicated to set up different ticket types so there is a learning curve at the start. We don't host a tonne of events on EventBrite so every time we do, we need to refamiliarise ourselves with the process.
overall: Overall: Has really made it easy to post events and coordinate ticket "sales" - how many tickets are left, cancellations, waiting lists, etc. Easy to promote on social media.

title: I love this product!
name: Anna W.
pros: Pros: when i get an invitation, it is by far the easiest procedure - to sign in, to sign up, and to rsvp to an event, invite others, or create my own. many awesome templates, and can save your invitees contact info, etc...
cons: Cons: i dont believe there is anything I dont like about this app! I get an invite, i'm encouraged to 'sign in for faster and easier rsvp', which in fact it is! I sign in, rsvp, and then done! It is so fast, done in seconds. What is there not to like about this app?

title: Eventbrite
name: Laura M.
comments: Comments: Overall an excellent event invitation software.
pros: Pros: The excellent thing about Eventbrite is that it has a lot of veraitility in style to send out invitations and saves previous information about guests, attendance and contact information for past and present events. It also allows for an organization to easily track how their sales and attendance is doing and gives a variety of ticket purchase options.
cons: Cons: The amount (%) taken out in ticket sales is a bit high compared to other credit card processing or other softwares.

title: Using Eventbrite more and more
name: Keagan C.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is super user friendly. It is very easy to work my way around the website, whether searching for an event(s) or if I am clicking an link that's taking me right to a specific event. The payment process through Eventbrite's website is also very cut and dry and simple to use. Lastly, I REALLY love that once I receive a confirmation email, a calendar event is created in my phone, I am asked to accept it and then within that event, my confirmation code and direct link to my confirmation email can be found!
cons: Cons: Don't have a specific item that comes to mind of what I don't like - it's a great service!

title: It's great!
name: Dan K.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is great for a quick and easy way to set up an event. You can easily add different payment options for your customers and even add descriptions for what the different options get you. It's great for everything from a golf outing to a simple free event.
cons: Cons: They take a percent of your ticket sales for operations. Yes, I know they have to operate - however, it would be great if their cut wasn't so high. For me, its a major turnoff when it comes to selling tickets for a high pricepoint. Might be better off looking at other platforms if you're actually selling tickets.

title: Great for small events!
name: Rachel M.
pros: Pros: I really enjoy the features provided for event management and for attendees. I think it's very straightforward, easy to use, and clean. It's helpful to organize the attendees as well. I've used it at several events, all without problems. I really like how you can export the event attendees very simply.
cons: Cons: I don't really have any complaints about it. I think the product is extremely easy to use, and I never had to ask for help on how to use it.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: I think that you should definitely consider it for your small events. I'm unsure how it works for large events.

title: Eventbrite is an underused resource!
name: C.F. J.
pros: Pros: Eventbrite is a great resource to stay in the know with what's happening in and around town. I like that I can use it to find upcoming events, such as, conferences, seminars, networking and do forth. It also can be used to promote your upcoming event(s).
cons: Cons: I think one thing Eventbrite can do is get their events SEO'd on web browsers. It would definitely help entrepreneurs gain more attendees and help Eventbrite, too.
overall: Overall: Overall, I've used it for years to either locate events in the area, to promote an event and to research.

title: Great ticketing solution for small events, concerts, etc.

title: Have an Event you Want to Have Tickets for? This is your platform

pros: Pros: It's free for organizers to use as long as your tickets are free, otherwise they charge per sale which is similar to other platforms where you sell stuff on. It integrates with just about EVERY other platform, social media, website, etc which is crucial if you want to get your event out there.
cons: Cons: The fees can be a little much if you're a smaller organization who's trying to get paid but not overcharge for your tickets, however, they are industry standard prices.
overall: Overall: Decent. Nothing really to complain about.
